definition: to piece together/to join together/to stake all/adventurous/at the risk of one's life/to spell
France/French/abbr. for 法國|法国[Fa3 guo2]/Taiwan pr. [Fa4]
law/method/way/to emulate/(Buddhism) dharma/(abbr. for 法家[Fa3 jia1]) the Legalists/(physics) farad (abbr. for 法拉[fa3 la1])

sentences.english: In this dictionary both spelling is show when both is possible.
sentences.chinese: 在两种拼法皆可时，本词典将之一并列出。

sentences.english: A word must be added on the orthography of her name.
sentences.chinese: 总之，必须加上对拼法她的名字。

sentences.english: Neither the twins nor James knows how to spell the word.
sentences.chinese: 对双生子和詹姆斯都不知道这个词的拼法。

sentences.english: Because I often misspell the word, therefore I very much pay attention to English now the spelling.
sentences.chinese: 因为我常把单词拼错，所以现在我很注意英语的拼法。

sentences.english: Spelling Trouble? Language, Ideology and the Reform of German Orthography.
sentences.chinese: 拼写麻烦吗？语言，思想方式与德语拼法革新。

sentences.english: Maybe English names have special pronunciation that you can pronounce after seeing them .
sentences.chinese: 还是英文名字有特殊的拼法，看见了就可以读出来。

sentences.english: There're many pitfalls in English spelling for foreign students.
sentences.chinese: 在英语拼法上有许多外国学生易犯的错误。

sentences.english: His is excellent some spelling mistakes.
sentences.chinese: 他的作文很好，只有几处拼法错误。

sentences.english: Words written alike are often pronounced differently.
sentences.chinese: 拼法相同的词往往读音不同。

sentences.english: By 1987, every major newspaper and news magazine in the US had followed suit.
sentences.chinese: 1987年，美国主要报刊杂志均采用了新的拼法。

sentences.english: It is made of stone slabs and the bow-like arch is unique.
sentences.chinese: 它以石块砌筑，弓形的拱圈拼法也有特殊。

sentences.english: Note my new name and how to spell it.
sentences.chinese: 留意我的新名字及它的拼法。

definition: pronunciation/literary (rather than colloquial) pronunciation of a Chinese character
Hanyu Pinyin, the romanization system used in the PRC since the 1960s
to put sth together from component parts
reading or phonetic value of a character
Cantonese romanization/Jyutping, one of the many Cantonese romanization systems
to pronounce a word after mentally processing its spelling/(phonics) blending
